content.question: Which of the following statements best explains the structure and importance of plasmids to prokaryotes?

choices.label: Plasmids are circular, single-stranded <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules that transfer information from the prokaryotic chromosome to the ribosomes during protein synthesis.

Plasmids are circular, double-stranded <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules that provide genes that may aid in survival of the prokaryotic cell.

Plasmids are single-stranded <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules, which are replicated from the prokaryotic chromosome, that prevent viral reproduction within the prokaryotic cell.

Plasmids are double-stranded <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules that are transmitted by conjugation that enable other prokaryotic cells to acquire useful genes.

content.answer: Plasmids are circular, double-stranded <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules that provide genes that may aid in survival of the prokaryotic cell.
